extends Object
    The methods class for the Lab 3 methods that you must write

    NOTE: This class is contained within the package cscd211Lab3;

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        public static int menu(Scanner kb)
        The menu method prompts the user to select from the following choices. Note: the carriage return is removed from the input buffer
        1. Print all Players to the screen
        2. Print all Players to the User Specified file
        3. Sort the Players by Natural Order
         4. Sort the Players by Team and print to the screen
        5. Sort the Players by Position and print to the screen
        6. Remove a player
        7. Print a entire team and only that team to a user specified file
        8. Quit
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        int - Representing the menu choice will be checked to be in range
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null

      • printList

        public static void printList(ArrayList<Player> list,
                             PrintStream fout)
        The printList walks thru the array list and prints the contents to the specified PrintStream
        Parameters:
        list - Representing the ArrayList of contain Players
        fout - Representing the PrintStream for output
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null

      • printTeamPlayers

        public static void printTeamPlayers(ArrayList<Player> list,
                                    Scanner kb)
        The printTeamPlayers prompts the user for the 3 letter code for a team and then walks thru the array list and prints the contents for that specific team. Note the carriage return is removed from the input buffer
        Parameters:
        list - Representing the ArrayList of contain Players
        kb - Representing the Scanner object for the keyboard
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null

      • readDirectoryContents

        public static File[] readDirectoryContents(File inDir)
                                    throws Exception
        The readDirectoryContents is passed a File object representing the directory from where to read the files. All individual files in the directory are converted to an array of individual File objects.

        Note: the method header contains throws Exception
        Parameters:
        inDir - Representing the directory to read from as a File object
        Returns:
        File [] Representing the files in the directory
        Throws:
        Exception - if a SecurityException occurs within the method
        NullPointerException - if the File object is null

      • readDirectoryName

        public static File readDirectoryName(Scanner kb)
        The readDirectoryName method prompts the user for a directory name and ensure the provided name is a directory before returning a file object that represents that directory. Note the carriage return is removed from the input buffer
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard.
        Returns:
        File - Representing the directory to read from
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null

      • readFileName

        public static String readFileName(Scanner kb)
        The readFileName method prompts the user for the name of the output file. Note the carriage return is removed from the input buffer
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard.
        Returns:
        String - Representing the output file name
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null

      • readPlayers

        public static ArrayList<Player> readPlayers(File[] inFileNames)
                                     throws Exception
        The readPlayers method reads the player information from the different Files and creates a Player object which it places within the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        inFileNames - Representing an array of File objects
        Returns:
        ArrayList Representing an array list of player objects of exact size.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the Scanner object has a problem
        NullPointerException - if the array of file names is null

      • removePlayer

        public static void removePlayer(ArrayList<Player> list,
                                Scanner kb)
        The removePlayer method prompts the user for Player information checks the ArrayList for that player and removes that player from the ArrayList ensure the new ArrayList is of exact size. If the Player does not exist the original ArrayList is not modified. Note: the carriage return is removed from the input buffer.
        Parameters:
        list - Representing the ArrayList of Players to remove from
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
